attributes.action: Petition the Government on energy prices
attributes.background: I want the government to take action on the huge increases in commercial energy prices.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Put a cap on commercial energy rates
2. Just putting a cap is not going to be enough so a fund needs to be set up by the government to help small businesses. The proceeds from this fund will be accessed directly by energy companies enabling them to include a credit on each bill issued to sme's much in the same way as the climate change levy is currently added to energy invoices.
3. The total effect of the above action should be that sme's energy costs are not impacted by more than 10% this year and not more than the inflation rate from next year.
Taking the above action is necessary and will ensure the survival of many small businesses.

rejection.details:
We think this petition is similar

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/603598

attributes.action: Remove standing charges from electricity supply charges
attributes.background: To get Electricity suppliers to remove standing charges from domestic / home bills
attributes.additional_details:
1) People would be better off meaning they would likely looks to move to electric cars and also from gas to electric appliances.

2) Domestic environmental emissions would likely be reduced.

3) Current energy price crisis would lower impact to electricity customers being charged before they even use any energy in the for of a Kw/hr

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about standing charges are a matter for utility providers and Ofgem, not the UK Government or Parliament.

The price cap is a cap on a unit of gas and electricity, with standing charges taken into account. Find out more about the energy price cap, including how it includes standing charges, here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you

attributes.action: Lower the energy price cap to 4%
attributes.background: Lower the energy price cap to 4%, in line with France. There is no need to raise energy prices by 54% when energy companies have made record profits! Help the public not to choose between eating and heating, instead of giving more money to those who don't need it.
attributes.additional_details:
This will help protect people from energy poverty, this will help the most vulnerable. Those who are unemployed, retired, on low incomes and anyone else who is struggling to pay these extreme price rises. 
If the government continues to not address this issue, people will have no choice but to stop paying their energy bills, also known as a bill strike.
3000 people die each year as a result of energy poverty, we will not accept anymore deaths.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

The energy cap is set by Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the Government and Parliament. You can find out more about how the energy price cap is set here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/publications/price-cap-increase-ps693-april

You might like to sign the following petitions, which call for related actions:

Subsidise energy prices to offset any increase in the energy price cap:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/606586

Tax 50% of the Energy Companies profits to help households pay bills: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607983

attributes.action: Free parking for NHS staff
attributes.background: Having had to work during the pandemic in unprecedented  pressures please for the loyalty to all the NHS staff make parking free In all hospitals for staff
attributes.additional_details: Because of the cost of living going up and tax rises and energy bills please give all the NHS staff at least one less thing to worry about by having to make extra money by doing extra long hours to pay for parking at there workplace

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/612699

attributes.action: A minimum price paid for the export of electricity from domestic renewables
attributes.background: We have a pricing cap on the cost of gas/electricity, why do we not have a minimum price set by the government for electricity generated by solar panels or other home renewables. It’s not fair we are getting paid a paltry 2p or 3.5p per kWh when the energy companies will be selling it for 20p to 30p
attributes.additional_details: To get a fairer return on people choosing to install home renewables and battery systems. We don’t want the feed in tariff prices back but a fair price that is reviewed like the energy cap. Take for instance the price for nuclear is around 9p per kWh at Hinckley. A fairer price would encourage people to invest in home renewables and reduce the overall carbon footprint of households.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

The rate paid to people using the Smart Export Guarantee (SEG) are set by electricity suppliers (SEG Licencees), not the Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Ensure fuel retailers are fair when changing fuel prices due to crude oil price
attributes.background: Ensure fuel retailers use the same criteria in fuel price increases/decreases, e.g. if fuel goes up 3p after 3 days of $5 increase in wholesale oil prices, then when the oil price falls by $5 fuel prices should decrease by at least 3p after 3 days. And prices should increase after fuel reaches pumps
attributes.additional_details: It takes 2-4 weeks to convert crude oil to fuel at pumps.  But fuel retailers raise prices within hours of an oil price increase and can wait weeks to reduce them after oil prices fall.  We’re in a terrible energy crisis.  A free-market economy shouldn’t be an excuse for profiteering from the economic misery of people and firms.  Price increases should be applied only when fuel produced from more expensive oil reaches the forecourt.  And the same criteria used for price increases and decreases.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The price of fuel is a decision for retailers.

attributes.action: Stop the installation of energy key meters  and stop disconnections for 1year
attributes.background: Stop energy companies installing key meters for those that are in energy arrears and stop disconnections for at least 1 year
attributes.additional_details: The energy crisis isn't going to end anytime soon. 70%of the world's energy is consumed by the wealthiest 10%. The first law of thermodynamics means there is no quick fix, this means  low income families will struggle.  By ensuring a continued supply of energy through stopping disconnections lives can be saved

rejection.details:
We currently have the below petition open which you might like to sign:

Ban the use of prepayment meters for energy provision.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607746

attributes.action:
Temporarily remove VAT from all fuel 
Domestic and for transportation
attributes.background:
Given the current situation simply remove VAT from all energy sources bills 
As a temporary measure to help everyone weather the current onslaught of price increases
attributes.additional_details:
As prices are going up at alarming levels (50% for domestic fuel alone) it seems the tax take will already be more than high so removing all VAT  would help the vast majority of citizens 
Once the current economic storm is over than a return to the standard model would be expected

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions, which call for similar or related actions:

Reduce fuel duty and VAT by 40% for a period of 2 years
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599089

Remove VAT from all domestic fuel, and provide price capping on heating oil
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/598647

Hold an urgent inquiry into the energy crisis, and remove VAT on fuel
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605609

Suspend VAT on road fuels to reduce fuel costs
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610567

attributes.action: Adopt a phased approach for removing entitlement to use rebated (red) diesel.
attributes.background: Introduce an annual escalator (starting on 1st April 2022) on fuel duty. Viable alternatives are simply not available or reasonably accessible. As a fiscal measure an escalator would stimulate more development, time for implementation and provide market ready conditions, whilst preserving businesses
attributes.additional_details: Sectors relying on rebated fuel are critical to the UK economy, society and the environment. Construction, Waste and other sectors will be seriously impacted by the removal of entitlement and will face catastrophic consequences in terms of ability to trade and provide essential services. The landscape is exceptionally different now compared to when the hike was announced, with ongoing issues flowing from; Covid, Brexit, driver shortages, economic recovery, energy crisis and consumer inflation

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Allow the Events industry to continue using red rebated fuels after 1 April 2022: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599254

Delay removal of red diesel entitlement from the construction industry: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607637

attributes.action: Go further with sanctions against Russia. Hold nothing back for 'later'.
attributes.background: To impose more sanctions on Russia even if to do so would mean an economic 'hit' for the UK. Do not hold anything back for later. There is no later for Ukraine. This is it. Do more to ensure other countries back 'evicting' Russia from SWIFT banking system. Include energy arrangements in sanctions.
attributes.additional_details: We hand out investment visas to many more Russians including those who have strong links to the Russian government. They invade Ukraine. We put tiny sanctions in place saying we need to hold something back in case they go into the rest of Ukraine. Now they have begun a full scale invasion and we are still holding back. Once this happens, that's it for Ukraine. No more freedom. And it won't end there with Russia.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609428

attributes.action: Urgently recommence fracking.
attributes.background: Given the current and future problems with energy supplies before we reach net zero, fracking should be started immediately to take advantage of our vast reserves of natural gas. This would smooth out our transition from one power source to another.
attributes.additional_details: We are being mercilessly squeezed by Russia which is manipulating supplies of gas to Europe. Independence from this could easily be reached simply by relicensing fracking. Our own source of natural gas is a far greener option to importing it in tankers from around the world.

rejection.details:
You may like to sign the below petition we currently have open on this topic:

Commit to UK natural gas and increase investment
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608274

attributes.action: Allow people to opt out of the £200 “loan” that the chancellor announced in Feb
attributes.background: There should be the option for consumers to opt in or out of a token gesture “loan” the government are ENFORCING on all households that has no formal application process and is recoverable over 5 years that not everyone wants or agrees too.
attributes.additional_details:
The energy industry is a privately run sector not public therefore it’s not for the government to decide on peoples financial situations without debate or options to choose if we want it or not. This “Loan” they enforce on the public comes without options for consumers to opt in or out based on their personal circumstances 

Loans are regulated by industry standards and affordability checks - offering a token £200 when cuts to green levies and VAT would be more effective are ignored again

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608007

attributes.action: Cancel the 2022 Energy Bills Rebate
attributes.background: The £200 Energy Bills Rebate is in fact an enforced loan on millions of people who would rather not to pay it or can't.
attributes.additional_details:
Energy suppliers will apply for the 'discount' and the Government meeting the costs.
With the public then paying the govt back automatically by equal £40 instalments over the next five years.

This rigid scheme is extremely flawed for people moving or sharing homes over the next 5 years.
Millions of struggling people could face paying back a 'loan' in which they never even needed or used.

Fairer proposals to tackle the UK energy bill crisis must be found.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608007

attributes.action: Stop the energy rebate
attributes.background:
It’s not a rebate, it’s an illegal loan. 

My daughter plans to move out of home, and into her own place, in the next 5 years. Meaning she will pay back a ‘loan’ she never receives. 

It’s a loan we don’t want, and don’t seem able to opt out of. Making it illegal, because we don’t consent.
attributes.additional_details:
We might not be able to afford the rise in fuel costs, but we definitely can’t afford to pay for that rise, along with repaying a loan we never asked for. 

This is not a rebate, because we have to pay it back. It is also not a loan, because we are not consenting to it. 

Some people like my daughter, will never have the loan, but will still have to pay money back. This will cause unnecessary debt, and needs to stop.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608007

attributes.action: The proposed £200 loan should be optional and not forced on the British public.
attributes.background:
The £200 loan proposed by the chancellor should not be forced on the British public as a whole. 
To force debt on the british public is morally reprehensible and everyone should have a choice.
Those that do choose to take it should pay it back directly to the treasurery not to the energy companies
attributes.additional_details:
The £200 loan is being fully funded by the government to the energy companies. That same £200 is then paid back to the energy companies through our bills. 
It is categorically wrong to allow the energy companies to profit in this way from the British publics tax burden and then again though our energy bills.
You are asking us to pay twice and calling it "help"

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608007

attributes.action: Stop mp’s claiming energy costs for 2nd Homes
attributes.background:
I want the giver not to descrimate vunerable and low paid workers by increasing their energy costs , while they are getting energy costs for free for 2nd homes 

There should be more help available for vulnerable and low income people in all areas of the Uk
attributes.additional_details:
What the government is doing is against the rule of law in the Uk 

You have people who are going to freeze to death , or die of hunger by going with out food and heating 

The government needs to put the needs of the  British people first 

You have people having £10,000 a year and having to pay £2,000 in energy costs , plus high inflation with food and fuel etc 

What the government is doing is against. Humanity and discrimination 

No one should have to live in poverty

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/

attributes.action: Scrap the National Insurance Hike
attributes.background: Scrap the 1.25% national tax hike immediately. We demand the Conservative government to explore alternative options.
attributes.additional_details: As we still navigate life amidst the ongoing pandemic, our Conservative government have decided that now - in the midst of an impending energy crisis, cost of living crisis, gas crisis - is the time to implement a national insurance hike of 1.25%, under the guise that this is needed to help the NHS. The results of this tax hike is going to be catastrophic, hitting low income families when they are already struggling.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/596514

attributes.action: Give help and  support for people  with their energy bills
attributes.background: People are going to endure 51% increase in their energy bills from April 2022, they are going to have to either eat or Heat
attributes.additional_details:
It's disgraceful that members of parliament and government employees etc  so the daily mail online alleges that MPs are claiming thousands of pounds in energy expenses for 2nd homes while claiming they could not help people on legacy benefits, people  with covid expenses people on low-income snd the most vulnerable in society 

Its seems the government are more focused on living s high-class lifestyle than looking after the most vulnerable in society .

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about the cost of energy bills, however it's not clear what specific forms of 'help and support' you want the Government to provide.

If there was a specific form of support you wanted the Government to introduce, such as a grant scheme, you could start a petition about that.

You might like to sign these petitions which call for related actions:

'Cut the VAT charged on energy bills': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/597470

'Cut VAT on domestic electricity to zero': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594293

'Hold an urgent inquiry into the energy crisis, and remove VAT on fuel': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605609

'Remove VAT from all domestic fuel, and provide price capping on heating oil.: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/598647

'Hold an inquiry into fuel prices and introduce increased regulation': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/603624

attributes.action: Government Intervention to Solve Energy Crisis
attributes.background: With the UK facing the worst energy crisis ever, no doubt sending many more people in to fuel poverty, it is absolutely ESSENTIAL that the UK Government intervene to help with this horrendous situation.
attributes.additional_details: If the UK Government do not intervene, thousands more families will be thrown in to fuel poverty which is already an issue in this country. More people will live in dreadful circumstances, unable to keep their homes warm and as a consequence, there will be more deaths, not only from illnesses, but from even greater mental health issues related to desperation.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the cost of energy, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Hold an urgent inquiry into the energy crisis, and remove VAT on fuel: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605609

Cut the VAT charged on energy bills: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/597470

Extend the energy price cap to small businesses: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/603598

Cut VAT on domestic electricity to zero: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594293

attributes.action: Stop energy companies hiking prices up and refund customers for the past months
attributes.background:
Energy prices have risen in the last few months meaning that everyone has been choosing to either ‘Heat or Eat’

This is diabolical in the stresses of a pandemic, Energy firms should be made to reimburse customers

This needs to end now across all energy providers and we capped.
attributes.additional_details:
The likes of British Gas, Eon and many more are refusing to pause prices to which is now doubling per day, the government must take action on this because it’s unfair whilst in a pandemic.

There are people with young families who are trying to cope and heat their homes, yet the energy firms won’t listen.

They should be made to refund customers for the past three months minimum for what the charges have been.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The cost of energy is a matter for energy companies, while the energy price cap is a decision for Ofgem.

attributes.action: Keep Lateral Flow Tests free for everyone
attributes.background: Government sources have leaked Boris Johnson’s plan to stop Lateral Flow Tests from being free. These plans must be addressed formally by the government and scrapped.
attributes.additional_details: Lateral flow tests have been an essential way to test before attending events, visiting vulnerable friends/family and also for work. By making them no longer free, this reduces the accessibility for the British public who are already facing an increase in national insurance, energy prices and more. Cases are still rapidly increasing and with COVID-19 mutating, this couldn’t come at a more inconvenient time.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/593320

attributes.action: Force closure of Scottish Power energy provider
attributes.background: Force the company to close down, including writing off customers so-called debts and so-called defaults, allowing all customers to change to another energy provider
attributes.additional_details:
Their call centres and online chat services are in India, which does not help the availability of jobs in our country. It also causes distress to customers as the language barrier causes much confusion and frustration.
They leave MANY people without energy to their home for days, weeks, and in some cases months at a time.
They write defaults on customers accounts without reason.
They add debts to accounts where there are no debts.
It can takes days to get through to them.
Over charging.

rejection.details:
The performance and customer service standards for energy companies is regulated by Ofgem and is not the direct responsibility of the Government or Parliament.

You can find out about how to complain to or about energy providers here:

https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/consumers/household-gas-and-electricity-guide/complain-about-your-gas-or-electricity-bill-or-supplier

attributes.action: Pause the determination of all solar developments that are over 40 Megawatts.
attributes.background: Government should review the regulatory framework which is in place to manage solar developments, to ensure it considers a broader range of factors than the current National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF), which is insufficient in preventing speculative development of our landscape.
attributes.additional_details: No solar development should be approved until their impact on the environment and biodiversity is understood. There is currently a clear policy conflict within Government.  On the one hand, Government seeks to protect and enhance our domestic production to maintain food security and recognises the pivotal role of farm land as a carbon sink. On the other, Government is encouraging the indiscriminate growth of renewable energy production. Growth of solar farms must be subject to better regulation.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We understand you are concerned about the impact that solar farms might have on the environment and would like to see changes to the regulations, but it's not clear if you want all approval of solar farms stopped or if you want changes to the regulations, and if so, what regulations on solar farms would you like the Government to action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Scrap VAT on energy bills
attributes.background: With energy bills now spiralling out of control, we need the government to scrap VAT on energy bills .
attributes.additional_details:
Once upon a time, the UK could set its own VAT on certain things, and energy bills didn’t have a huge VAT bill added to them, but then the EU insisted we should all be charged the same VAT rate on fuel bills all over The EU state.
During the Brexit campaign, the Prime Minister pointed out that this is one of the things our government could change when we left the EU.
So now energy prices are spiralling out of control and every day families are suffering with all sorts of other tax rises, this could help with the burden of paying the bills.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Cut the VAT charged on energy bills: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/597470

Cut VAT on domestic electricity to zero: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594293

attributes.action: Revamp the Children’s play park on Town End Farm.
attributes.background: Clear up and revamp the play park on the Town End Farm estate in Sunderland and install lockable gates to be locked on a night to stop it getting ruined by older kids.
attributes.additional_details: Our children have no where to play or burn off their energy unless we walk for a couple of mile to the next estate and with young children that can be a problem if people don’t have transport. The park has no swings and rubbish covers the area and it has not been updated in many years so all play equipment is old. There should be high gates that can be locked to stop older children from entering the park after hours and ruining the equipment for the younger children.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local children's parks are a matter for your local authority, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Energy companies to remove the Standing Charge from Gas and Electricity bills.
attributes.background: If the Government are unable to remove the V.A.T from fuel bills, then they should look at the cost of the standing charge on those bills. At the moment in the North East on a standard tariff, they amount to over £226 per year. This is increased at every fuel price adjustment and totally unfair.
attributes.additional_details: At a time of rising fuel costs, this is a charge on fuel bills for nothing in return. The power companies have a silent tax with these charges. We need to lower the cost of ever spiraling energy prices.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for energy providers.

attributes.action: Take energy companies back into public hands
attributes.background:
We are in the midst of a crisis that has caused many energy suppliers to go bust. The current record increase in prices is set to go up further next year - over £400 per household in total.
Gas prices and electricity prices have increased by 50% and 30% respectively since privatisation in the 1980s
attributes.additional_details:
Price rises on this scale will force many people to choose between heating and eating, coming at the same time as many are already at breaking point thanks to the cut in universal credit, the increase in national insurance and soaring food prices.
This crisis shows that the privatisation of the energy sector and its regulation has not worked. 
We call on the government to:
- Nationalise the energy sector
- No bailouts for energy companies
- Secure low-price green energy supplies into the future.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/597613

attributes.action: The HMRC mileage rate for EV vehicles for business use to be increased from 4p
attributes.background: The HMRC mileage rate for EV vehicles for business use to be increased from 4p. This was set at 4p in 2017/18 and now with increasing cost of electricity and on the road charging cost does not fully cover the cost of the electricity needed to charge the EV. The current rate does not promote EV use
attributes.additional_details: Increasing the rate would be another tool to encourage people to swap to EV’s and for companies to promote this too. Lots of companies are promoting use of Hybrids but this still get the 45p rate from business mileage. An increase in rate for EV would support the take up of EV’s in business further. This measure fits with the BIK discount and promotion of the green economy where business can support the transition to EV and away from fossil fuels in cars and vehicles. the energy cost is so high

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is an operational decision for HMRC.

The HMRC rate is calculated using published consumption rates, adjusted to reflect real driving conditions and the average cost of electricity, and are subject to quarterly review.

attributes.action: Scrap plans to raise National Insurance for workers earning below 100K per annum
attributes.background: Change the policy so that it applies to those who earn above 100K a year. In doing so, the rise will be less significant for those affected; especially as energy prices are rising too. Currently, the increase will cause those who already struggle to be forced into more detrimental circumstances.
attributes.additional_details: Over the last two years the government has overlooked social care issues in the UK & wasted money in other areas: £37 Billion on test & trace, £220 Billion+ on Brexit (and more). The average British citizen did not choose to spend our money in this way and we should not have to pay for the mistakes made by the government when they would be detrimental to the quality of many lives. Raising the tax for the richest in society is the only logical and ethical way forward in the long-term.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for a similar action: 

Limit National Insurance increases to high earners:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/596280

No to any National Insurance increase to ‘fund’ social care:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/596514

attributes.action: Have the government take the climate crisis seriously and act on it urgently
attributes.background: Listen to the IPCC report warning; end fossil fuel investment immediately and invest in green fuel. Agree to a Green new deal that takes the climate crisis seriously and does everything that it can to reverse the damage. Invest in rewilding, local food, local energy and climate emergency centres.
attributes.additional_details:
As a mother, the current way that the client crisis is being dealt with by the government is blatantly disregarding my children's future. I want them to be able to live on a planet that is healthy and well cares for by its human inhabitants. 

We have the means, but we don't have the time. We need our leaders to take care of our children's future and to use their power to make positive change. Working nationally and at regional and community level, leaders can make this happen.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the climate crisis, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Introduce charges on carbon emissions to tackle climate crisis and air pollution: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574678

Create a fund for e-fuel technology research and deployment: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/576193

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Reduce taxes on electricity to allow heat pumps to be installed in the UK
attributes.background: Reduce taxes and "environmental levies" on electricity to encourage the UK supply chain for heat pump installations, to encourage gas fitters to retrain as heat pump engineers, to allow people to invest in clean energy.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK imposes 23% taxes on electricity, but only 2% on gas. These taxes are preventing the decarbonisation of heat in the UK. Government needs to switch taxes from electricity to gas to allow people to run heat pumps, to fight climate change, to encourage the long-term supply chain for heat pumps, reduce imports and support clean energy.
The UK cannot start to achieve 600,000 heat pump installations a year by 2028 until it reduces taxes on electricity - at least for those who install heat pumps.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about taxes on electricity and the disincentives this creates for installing heat pumps, but we're not sure exactly what taxes and levies you want to be changed, by how much, or whether you want this to apply to domestic or business electricity supplies, or both.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. If what you really want is to see increased uptake of heat pumps, it might be clearer to call for the Government to provide grants or subsidies for uptake or installation of heat pumps.

attributes.action: Bring forward British Summertime to February 28th 2021
attributes.background: To raise the morale of the UK bringing forward British Summer Time would give us more light in the evenings.  It would encourage more of the population into outside spaces. This would also help those with mental health issues reducing the length of the longer dark evenings.
attributes.additional_details:
Transferring an hour of daylight from the morning to the evening will make better use of this free commodity.  After such an horrendous year bringing forward the clock change to the end of February will enable us to make better use of daylight. This will also help boost the hard hit tourism and hospitality industries.  More light in the evenings could also reduce energy bills and help towards reducing the UK carbon footprint.

If this proposal is implemented it could also confirm the viability of permanent British Summer Time.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574111

attributes.action: Urge the British Government to provide jobs for British unemployed.
attributes.background: Guarantee a bright future for all in Brits by producing a firm plan to manage future energy needs and keep the jobs and supply of products and goods inhouse from cradle to grave, from project conception to decommissioning and ultimate recycling no matter which party is in power.
attributes.additional_details: Britain’s energy workers are suffering because of Covid 19 and the accelerated push towards carbon neutrality. This needs to be managed properly and safeguarded against the get rich quick entrepreneurs who are jumping on the bandwagon for personal gain.

attributes.action: Keep John Carroll Leisure Centre Open
attributes.background:
We are calling upon the Government and Nottingham City Council to 
halt the closure of John Carroll Leisure Centre and provide proper funding for community facilities in the most deprived parts of the Nottingham.
attributes.additional_details:
John Carroll Leisure Centre is the last real community facility available in Radford, Nottingham. For decades it has served as place where children build the confidence they need to succeed and a sporting facility for under-funded schools. 

Our Labour City Council has squandered the city's cash on it's failed Robin Hood Energy investment and is forcing the poorest communities in the city to pay the price. 

We call on the council to properly invest in the centre and the government to intervene.

rejection.details:
You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council directly. Find out how to petition your council here:

attributes.action: Change building regulation, so house builders build more energy efficient home.
attributes.background:
I want the building regulation to change now, we are so behind our European friends in building efficiency, using renewable technologies.
Major house builders are building houses that have poor CO2 standards & have been getting away with it for years. Our old & new housing stock is very poor.
attributes.additional_details: Im a renewables technician, i see so many developments being built with a couple of PV panels on the roof(tick a box),  still installing oversized gas/oil boilers, not installing or thinking of future technologies like Heat Pumps. We want to reduce CO2, so why are major house builders not leading the way in this. Because the current regulations are at such a low standard, they dont have to. One major house builder still made profit of 296m pre tax profit in 2020.

rejection.details: We think this petition is similar to yours: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332338

attributes.action: Allow grassroots football to continue playing for the health of children.
attributes.background:
If schools are to be kept open with children mixing in classes of 30, then why does grassroots football have to stop?  We coaches are covid secure, with social distancing in place, and plenty of fresh air to keep the children happy and healthy. 

Keep youth football alive and running as normal.
attributes.additional_details:
Football is a huge part of local community life, with many children playing and training each week. We have children from all parts of life, and all backgrounds and for some this is the only time they get out of their houses and be part of something special.

Football is a way to release energy, keep fit, make friends, learn new skills and have a chance to achieve new goals.

Coaches put so much time into being covid secure and maintaining distancing and a safe environment to train and play.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557169

attributes.action: Gyms to stay OPEN during lockdown.
attributes.background:
NHS website states "Research shows that physical activity can also boost self-esteem, mood, sleep quality and energy, as well as reducing your risk of stress and depression."
Improves your overall mood - considering the current circumstances it is vital to try to stay positive. No gym = struggles
attributes.additional_details:
Its a necessity for me & many other members of the public to go the the gym. The pandemic has been 8 months, 6 months with no gym. Back into the swing of things since gyms reopened & I physically cannot go through another lockdown without being able to go to the gym. Gyms are needed for many personal reasons. Mental & physical wellbeing & overall health. "If
 exercise were a pill, it would be one of the most cost-effective drugs ever invented," says Dr Nick Cavill, a health promotion consultant.

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Don't turn clocks back during coronavirus pandemic.
attributes.background:
The coming winter we will spend more time indoors. We need every available hour of sunlight to be able to go outside and benefit from sunshine. Sunshine delivers vitamin D, which has been linked with reducing the effects of COVID-19.
This will also reduce energy use, helping combat Climate Change.
attributes.additional_details: We call on the UK Government to urgently consider the circumstances and benefits of not turning the clocks back this year, and of course going forward.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321333

attributes.action: Stop clocks going back on Sunday, 25 October 2020
attributes.background: The European Parliament has voted to stop moving clocks forward an hour in spring and back again in the autumn. Politicians passed the measure by 410 votes to 192 - meaning seasonal time shifts, which were introduced during World War One to save energy, will end in 2020
attributes.additional_details:
This is an antiquated law for the outdated reasons above. Furthermore and especially in these unprecedented times it interrupts our sleep patterns, reduces our exposure to vitamin C and makes commuting less likely as both sides of the work day are dark - this increases planet pollution.
For once we need our government to make a simple decision for simple reasons. Its not Brexit and its not a referendum, just common sense.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321333

attributes.action: Scrap plans to make calorie information mandatory on menus
attributes.background: The proposed measures of making calorie information mandatory on menus could be incredibly damaging to the 1.25 million people in the United Kingdom who suffer from Eating Disorders, including Anorexia Nervosa, which has the highest mortality rate of any psychiatric disorder.
attributes.additional_details:
Research into including calorie information on menus shows that it -at best- has no/little effect, and -at worst- can be damaging. Furthermore, it wrongly promotes calorie counting, and the idea that a lower calorie food is healthier, when it in fact just provides less energy. If this plan goes ahead, the information should be available on a separate menu or online, to make it possible to be avoided.
Issues and sources can be found here: https://1drv.ms/w/s!AlXHZGFP3hTOikZvn_hhgK_fnIjh?e=BR8aFX

attributes.action: Build a skate park in Hyde Park
attributes.background: As you may know, skateboarding has been on the rise especially with the addition of the sport to the olympics. Many young people are flooding the streets with their skateboards and clogging the pavements.
attributes.additional_details: A skatepark offers a place for skateboarders to go without risking hurting themselves or others in the streets with lots of pedestrians around. Additionally, a place for young people to work out energy or train may be beneficial for mental health among young people. We would like the local council to build a skatepark similar to the one in Guildford.

attributes.action: Force energy companies to reduce the pence per unit across all existing tariffs
attributes.background: I would like the government to instruct all energy companies to reduce the pence per unit for electricity and gas usage for all existing tariffs until the government decides working from home or self isolation is no longer required.
attributes.additional_details:
With all people who can work from home doing so and the majority of the UK self isolating, the energy usage is going to increase dramatically causing a massive hike in energy bills for existing customer who simply will not be able to afford it.
For someone working from home this is a potential increase of 8 hrs per day 5 days a week in electricity use alone, with additional use of PC's, tablets and phones for children and students who also have to do school work online.

attributes.action: Wave council tax payments for the first three months of 2020-21 due to Covid-19
attributes.background:
Council tax is charged to anyone that owns or rents property in the UK.
These bills can sometimes be in their hundreds depending on circumstances
We feel that due to the financial crisis caused by coronavirus, that councils should not charge for the first three months of the 2020-21 tax year.
attributes.additional_details:
With the situation with workers potentially having to self isolate themselves and their families while still having the burden of not working there will be issues with finances. 
SSP will just about cover food and something towards energy bills but nothing else. 
This will prevent debt and give relief to many people while the economy recovers.
The public need as much relief as possible and this will help.
